Class Computer

java.lang.Object
Devices.Device
Devices.Computer
public class Computer extends Device
Represents a Computer device in the network. A Computer can send and receive messages, make ARP requests, and visit domains by resolving them via DNS.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

    Fields inherited from class Devices.Device

    getTotalPorts()
    Returns the number of ports on the computer.

    sendMessage(String destinationIP, String message, Topology topology)
    Sends a message to a destination IP address If the MAC address is not in the ARP table, an ARP request is performed
    void
    visitDomain(Topology topology, String domain, Computer pc)
    Visits a website by resolving a domain name through the connected DNS server If the domain is successfully resolved -> requests content from the WebServer

    • Computer

      public Computer(String name, String macAddress)
      Constructs a Computer with the specified name and MAC address.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the computer
      macAddress - the MAC address of the computer

  • Method Details

    • getTotalPorts

      public int getTotalPorts()
      Returns the number of ports on the computer.
      Overrides:
      getTotalPorts in class Device
      Returns:
      the number of total ports (always 1 for a computer)

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String destinationIP, String message, Topology topology)
      Sends a message to a destination IP address If the MAC address is not in the ARP table, an ARP request is performed
      Parameters:
      destinationIP - - the destination IP address
      message - - the message to send
      topology - - the network topology for device lookup/communication

    • visitDomain

      public void visitDomain(Topology topology, String domain, Computer pc)
      Visits a website by resolving a domain name through the connected DNS server If the domain is successfully resolved -> requests content from the WebServer
      Parameters:
      topology - - the current network topology
      domain - - the domain name to resolve
      pc - - the requesting computer
